subject: Re: I need technical support
preview: Hello!  We haven't heard back from you on this topic in a while so we're going to go ahead and close this conversation.  However, if you do need further assistance you can simply reply and the convers

full_threads.body:
Hello!

We haven't heard back from you on this topic in a while so we're going to go ahead and close this conversation.

However, if you do need further assistance you can simply reply and the conversation will be reopened or you can start a new conversation.

Let us know if you need further assistance!

Reply in our Messenger

You may need to sign in to Kinsta again.

You can also reply directly to this email.
Jovana from Kinsta
On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 11:26 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Please let me know if you have any questions :)

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 11:15 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

For enabling emails sending again unfortunately I think we will have to clear the queue first because most of this will be spam. After that I will enable it again :)

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 10:58 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

We've completed the repair of the infected site.
There were several malicious files found within the site that I've moved to private/suspected.

As a precaution, I have reset the site's SFTP and Database passwords. Additionally, any old backups containing Malware have been removed from the site. I've taken a manual backup for you of the clean-state of the site in case you need to restore it.

There are some action items that you will need to take in order to protect the site:

Below you will see a list of all WordPress users with administrator access to the site. Please review this list carefully and then log into your site and delete any administrators that are no longer needed or that you do not recognize:
ID user_login display_name user_email user_registered roles
1 admin admin pa@metrorehab.com.au 2015-05-08 06:47:11 administrator
17 Brittany Grimble Brittany Grimble brittany@practiceedge.com.au 2020-08-22 05:27:24 administrator
14 Janina Janina Hipolito Janina.Hipolito@Royalrehab.com.au 2020-05-20 04:44:43 administrator
13 Martina Martina Fox Martina.Fox@Royalrehab.com.au 2020-05-20 02:45:34 administrator
15 metrorehab-joel Joel joel@wpperk.com 2020-08-04 23:15:07 administrator
16 metrorehab-support WP Perk Support support@wpperk.com 2020-08-04 23:15:40 administrator
18 Practice Edge Practice Edge practiceedge01@gmail.com 2020-08-22 05:37:33 administrator
11 Trudy McEnearney Trudy McEnearney trudy.mcenearney@royalrehab.com.au 2019-09-18 02:30:14 administrator


As a preventative measure we have updated the WordPress salts in the wp-config.php file. This will have the effect of causing all users to be logged out of the site. So all users will have to log in the next time they access the site.
In addition, please note that the SFTP/SSH and database passwords have been changed. The next time you use SFTP/SSH or access phpMyAdmin you will need to use the updated passwords.

We would ask that you take the following steps within the next 24 hours:
* Install any available updates to the WordPress core and the site's themes and plugins.
* Require all administrators to change their WordPress passwords.
* Require all MyKinsta users to change their passwords.

Known vulnerabilities in older versions of plugins, themes, and the WordPress core are a common point of entry for malicious activity. As a result, it is our policy that any site that has been infected with malware must have the WordPress core, as well as all plugins and themes updated to the latest version within 24 hours of repair. If this is not done the site will no longer be eligible for future free malware removal.

Please notify us as soon as updates have been applied so that we can update our records to reflect that all updates have been applied.

Finally, please note that we have disabled the theme and plugin editors in the WordPress admin area. While we recommend leaving these disabled permanently, if you do use them you can reenable them after all users have updated their passwords by removing these lines from your site's wp-config.php file:

##Disable Editing in Dashboard
define('DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT', true);

Let us know if you have any questions!

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 10:42 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

You are more than welcome :)

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 10:41 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Thanks

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 10:41 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Sure, I will start now and keep you updated :)

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 10:40 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Yes please. It seems stable now since I replaced the contact forms. thanks

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 10:39 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I have checked and site is still infected with malware.

Do you want us to proceed with cleanup?

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 10:26 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi, sure, please allow me few moments for that :)

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 10:25 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Ok all done, can you please rescan for malware?

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:39 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hello, are you still there? :)

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:22 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Thank you for understanding and your cooperation :) Please let us know if you wants us to start with malware removal process? :)

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:21 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

oh ok sure

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:21 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Thank you :) I can re enable it when site is clean from malware, since this issues were related. I hope you understand :)

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:19 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Ok got it. I am currently working on it now. Can it please be renabled as I have deactivated the contact form plugin that was causing the issue. Thanks!

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:18 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Great that site is back now :) Do you want us now to proceed with malware cleanup? :) Well, I can not share results of our internal tool scan, but as my colleague Alessandro mentioned in the email sent 45 minutes ago:

Our security system detected unusual email activity on your site www[.]metrorehab[.]com[.]au. Our system deactivated email sending to prevent any potential spam email usage here.

Upon further investigation it appears that your contact form is being used by bots and/or spammers. We would strongly suggest that you protect all your forms with a captcha or Akismet or a similar system.

Please let us know once adjustments have been made such as captcha enabled or the form disabled so that we may re-enable email services for you.

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:16 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

I could see from the logs that the contact form 7 plugin was creating errors. So I manually deactivated them and that has brought the site online again.

Do you know what files are infected specifically?

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:12 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

You can, but still there will be possibility that it will be reinfected again, that is why the best is to clean it. But you can try backup restore now, and I will rescan it when it is done, is that ok with you?

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:10 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Yes, but could we also maybe try to restore a backup?

Would that not be quicker?

I cant really wait up to 24 hours, my client won't be impressed. I hope that makes sense?

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:10 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Ok, thanks for testing. On my side it works when I restart php, but it is still down on your side. 502 error can be present, because of resources, server side issues, or client side issues, and also because of third-party plugins and themes with bad code or unoptimized queries are also things to watch out for. https://kinsta.com/blog/502-bad-gateway/
Since we detected malware on your site, it is probably the cause of this error. I need your permission to clean it, and if you agree, we will do it in less then 24 hours.

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:06 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

I've tried on 3 browsers and cleared my cache, still no luck

And I tested it from external machines, they are all showing 502's as well

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:03 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Can you try clearing your browser cache? On my side it works now

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:01 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

No it doesnt seem to be loading

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 09:00 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I restarted PHP and now your site is up on my side, can you please check?

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 08:55 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Can we try and restore a back up if you feel that it's a malware issue?

I didn't think a 502 relates to the application? Isn't it more of a server level issue?

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 08:54 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I am going to be transferring this conversation to our malware team for assistance. Please note that they are not available on a 24/7 timeframe as Support is. The malware team works more traditional Monday-Friday North American business hours, so you can expect a reply during those times as soon as possible. We take this problem seriously and will work to resolve the issue in 24 hours or less.

You do not need to wait here in MyKinsta for a response! If you're not logged in when a member of the malware team replies, you will receive an email. You can reply to that email or log back into MyKinsta and respond to the conversation there.

Since I am transferring this conversation to the malware team, no one on the Support team will see further responses. If you need any assistance on a support issue, please go ahead and open a new conversation right here in MyKinsta. We're here 24/7 to help!

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 08:52 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi Jovana, any updates?

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 08:43 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Sure, please let me check :)

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 08:40 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi the site MetroRehab.com.au is down

can you please look into it?

It's showing a 502 error message

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 08:38 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I hope you are well and safe :) How can I help you today?

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 08:34 PM, "Jovana Djordjevic" <jovana.djordjevic@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hello there :)

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 08:31 PM, "Kinsta" <operator@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Please describe in detail the site performance issue you're experiencing so that we can help!

Be sure to include the site name or domain name so we can provide faster support.

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 08:31 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Site Performance

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 08:31 PM, "Kinsta" <operator@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Sure thing! Our support team is here 24/7 to assist you as needed.

Please select a topic from the list below:

On Thu, Sep 3, 2020 at 08:31 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

I need technical support
